description: Russian literature has always been more than literature, serving as the major catalyst for
cultural and social change in the country. This was especially true and important in the Soviet
Union, where censors controlled literary production at every level, in terms of form and content.
The readings for this course span the entire Soviet era, including such authors as Zamyatin, Ilf
and Petrov, Olesha, Platonov, Kharms, Bulgakov, Solzhenitsyn, and Petrushevskaya. In
